Positions.Title: Technical Principal
Positions.Responsibilities: Facilitated technical understanding and deliverables between clients and engineering teams. Ensured fulfillment of contractual obligations within agreed timelines and quality standards. Developed personalized training manuals for team-specific cases and mentored junior Technical Principals in client management. Led the development of a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) based on the AWS Well-Architected Framework, optimizing cloud costs, enhancing security postures, and improving account architecture. Built and trained a team to develop and maintain a highly available failover VDI environment for 8,000 stock traders.

Positions.Title: Software Engineering Manager
Positions.Responsibilities: Created Value Stream Maps to identify inefficiencies, reducing development time by up to 20%. Trained engineering teams on cloud best practices and architectural decision-making, resulting in reduced cloud expenses, improved security, and adherence to both general and specific best practices.

Positions.Title: Lead Consultant
Positions.Responsibilities: Designed DO-178C-compliant Terraform Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for remote pilots to interface with unmanned aerial vehicles. Trained the engineering team on Terraform best practices and CI/CD implementations. Developed a one-click IaC solution to accelerate cloud adoption by 50%. Built HIPAA-compliant serverless solutions using CloudFormation and Python for healthcare customers to streamline cross-state insurance plan coverage.

Positions.Title: SRE
Positions.Responsibilities: Developed a serverless application for mortgage brokers to submit property data for commercial real estate developments, accelerating deal closure times by 300%.

Positions.Title: DevOps Engineer
Positions.Responsibilities: Managed and reviewed change management and implementation processes. Resolved deployment issues in production environments using PowerShell on Windows servers.

Positions.Title: SRE
Positions.Responsibilities: Maintained and enhanced HIPAA-compliant AWS infrastructure with a focus on high availability and self-healing failover mechanisms. Improved system resiliency and operational efficiency.

Positions.Title: DevOps Engineer
Positions.Responsibilities: Built a one-click CI/CD pipeline, enabling globally distributed engineers to deploy reliable changes into development environments with rollback strategies. Reduced deployment times from 24 hours to 20 minutes.

profile.Name: Martin Feineis
profile.Description: I grew up in Waldb체ttelbrunn and attended Deutschhaus Gymnasium in W체rzburg, where I earned my Abitur in 2006. Following military service, I pursued a bachelor's degree in technical physics at Technische Universit채t Ilmenau, graduating in 2011. While working at Siemens in Berlin, I began a master's degree in electrical engineering at FernUniversit채t Hagen. After relocating to the United States in 2014, I transitioned into software engineering in Philadelphia, leaving my master's degree unfinished.

pictures.altText: Celebrating Open Source Technology for Enterprise
Professional picture from a company conference

TechIcons.Name: Martin Feineis
TechIcons.content: Click on any picture to learn more.
TechIcons.Description: My experience with Java, Vue.js, and Nuxt.js demonstrates my proficiency in developing and deploying web applications. My expertise in Terraform and Infrastructure as Code highlights my ability to automate infrastructure provisioning and management. Proficiency in cloud service providers such as AWS, Azure, GCP, and Linode, coupled with advanced skills in Linux, PowerShell, and Python, underscores my versatility across platforms. I focus on leveraging technology to streamline development, deployment, and operational processes.

Linux.title: Linux
Linux.desc: I run non-critical projects like PostgreSQL, Plex, or Minikube on my home Linux server.

AWS.title: AWS
AWS.desc: I manage infrastructure on AWS, including Lambda Functions, API Gateways, DynamoDB, and VPCs.

Terraform.title: Terraform
Terraform.desc: I use Terraform to deploy AWS infrastructure, storing state in S3 and DynamoDB. Many stacks include cross-account deployments via pipelines.

Nuxt.title: Nuxt
Nuxt.desc: This website was developed using Vue.js and Nuxt.js. Additional projects are hosted on Vercel Playground.

Python.title: Python
Python.desc: The backend of my contact form runs on Python in AWS Lambda Functions.

Git.title: Git
Git.desc: I use Git for version control across GitHub, AWS CodeCommit, and GitLab, leveraging CI/CD pipelines like GitHub Actions and Jenkins.
